lead_paragraph: The governor of Heilongjiang Province said wages at a state-owned company were in arrears and obliquely blamed underlings for his earlier statement that they had been paid on time.

byline.contributor: Owen Guo and Adam Wu contributed research.

headline.print_headline: Chinese Official Admits Delay in Miners’ Wages
headline.main: Official Admits He Gave Misleading Account of Chinese Miners’ Plight

snippet: The governor of Heilongjiang Province said wages at a state-owned company were in arrears and obliquely blamed underlings for his earlier statement that they had been paid on time.
abstract: Chinese official Lu Hao, in rare public reversal, admits that there has been delay in miners' wages following protests by workers at huge failing state coal mine in northeastern China; episode highlights problems within slumping industry, which is struggling with oversupply of workers.
